items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees adopted the District's operating budget at its meeting on September 13, 2011.  As required by Board Policy 6250, subsequent budget transfers and revisions must be approved by the Board of Trustees.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees.  District Policy adopted on April 10, 2007 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval.  All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the bid limit (current bid limit is $81,000) should have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $750, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts and purchase orders for the period of May 10, 2012 through June 9, 2012 as noted in the attached documents.

items.item_details:
ACCEPT AS INFORMATION ITEMS 
Project Highlights 
EVC Central Energy Plant & Police Renovation – Design Presentation 
	 
District Office 
Follow-up presentation on the conceptual costs of building a new facility at EVC and for the purchase and renovation of an off-campus facility.
	 
Monthly Measure G-2010 Summary Report through June 30, 2012 
Attached please find the Measure G-2010 Summary Report through June 30, 2012
	 
APPROVE AS ACTION ITEMS 
Contracts
Approval to Utilize Lease/Leaseback Delivery Method
At the Board meetings held March 13, 2012 and June 12, 2012, the Board was presented information and details by the Program Management team and District legal counsel on the Lease/Leaseback project delivery method.  The Board is asked to approve this method for two Measure G-2010 projects – San Jose City College Theater & Vocational Technology project and the EVC South Campus Development project.
	 
Master Agreement and Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) – Anderson Brule Architects - SJCC Phase 1 Painting Project Design Services
In response to a Request for Qualifications for Professional Architectural Services, five design professional firms were selected to provide design services via a Master Agreement as may be requested related to Measure G-2010 projects.  Anderson Brule Architects, a woman-owned small business, is one of the five firms.  Following on that award, San Jose City College requested a proposal from Anderson Brule Architects to evaluate and develop design services to address various painting needs of the campus.  The response was evaluated by the College and based on that review Anderson Brule Architects was selected to provide the services.  The Board is asked to approve issuance of a Master Agreement and PAA to Anderson Brule Architects in the amount of $36,000 for Phase 1 Painting Design Services at SJCC.
	 
Standard Form of Agreement (Design Professional Services) – Marcy Wong Donn Logan Architects – SJCC Performing Arts Center & Vocational Technology Building
	 
In keeping with the updated Facilities Master Plan for SJCC approved by the Board on November 29, 2011, a Request for Qualifications and Proposal for Professional Design Services was issued for the Performing Arts Center and Vocational Technology Building at SJCC.
	 
As a result of the received responses and interviews with short-listed firms, the College selected the firm of Marcy Wong Donn Logan Architects, a woman-owned firm, for professional design services.  The Board is asked to approve the award of programming design services for the San Jose City College Performing Arts Center & Vocational Technology Building to Marcy Wong Donn Logan Architects in the amount of $201,777.
	 
	 
Professional Service and Construction Change Orders 
Professional Service Change Order to Allana Buick and Bers Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC-01 –– EVC Gullo Student Services Center
The Gullo Student Services Center at EVC has experienced roof and wall leaks for many years.  The leaks have caused interior damage and pose potential risk to equipment.  The Board approved issuance of a Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) to Allana Buick and Bers (ABB) at its May 8, 2012 Board meeting to provide a condition assessment and design services related to the issues with the building’s roof.  As a result of the condition assessment it was found that the building’s exterior wall was in need of repair as well.
	 
ABB was selected in competition with two other firms because of its expertise in building exterior envelope investigation.  Based on that expertise, its current knowledge of Gullo and the desire to have the roof and wall repairs made during the summer of 2013 (during minimal College activity), the Board is requested to approve a revision to the original PAA that broadens the scope of services by ABB to include detailed assessment of the building exterior wall and provide design services to repair or replace the exterior wall of the Gullo Student Services Center at EVC.
	 
Professional Service Change Order to Aedis Architecture & Planning Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC-01– EVC Central Energy Plant & Police Renovation
On January 10, 2012 the Board approved a Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) to Aedis to provide design professional services for the EVC Central Energy Plant (CEP) & Police Renovation.  As the design has completed the program phase, it is necessary at this time to revise the PAA to reflect the approved project program documents by 1) adjusting the identified project construction cost to $10,216,979 (as identified in Bond List Revision #2 approved by the Board on May 8, 2012), and 2) increasing the PAA amount by $18,118 to align with the adjusted project construction cost, and 3) modifying the PAA Schedule of Values to reflect the increased PAA amount and 4) making minor changes to the terms of the PAA that more accurately reflect project parameters.  The Board is asked to approve Change Order #1 to the Aedis PAA EVC-01 per the above.
	 
Professional Service Change Order to Aedis Architecture & Planning Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC-02 – Police Station Interim Housing and Measure G-2010 Offices
On May 8, 2012 the Board approved a Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) to Aedis to provide design professional services for interim Police operations during renovation and remodel of the Police station at EVC and for housing program/construction management staff related to Measure G-2010.  A revision to that PAA is necessary to 1) reflect the current planning that consolidates these temporary buildings onto one site on the EVC campus and 2) reflect the necessity that all these buildings be reviewed and approved by DSA, and 3) increase the amount of the PAA by $15,895 to accommodate the additional design services and contract administration required of the design professional for DSA projects.  The Board is asked to approve a no-cost Change Order #1 to the Aedis PAA EVC-02 for the Police Station Interim Housing and Measure G-2010 Offices to accurately reflect revised project parameters as noted above.
	 
Professional Service Change Order to HMC Architecture Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC-01 – South Campus Programming
On April 10, 2012 the Board approved a PAA to HMC Architecture for the initial programming of the Science and Mathematics Building at EVC.  Based on that effort, which is now complete, the College developed what is now called the “South Campus Development” which consolidates the design and construction work of the proposed Fitness Center, Social Science Classroom Building and the Science and Mathematics Building into one project. It is necessary at this time to proceed into detailed building programming for this project.
	 
The Board is asked to approve the issuance of a Professional Service Change Order to HMC Architecture for detailed building programming design services at EVC for the South Campus Development project in the amount of $87,600.
	 
	 
Bond List Revisions 
None

items.item_details:
The BAR Smog Referee and student training program helps to improve the quality of the air in California while training students in critical technical skills.  Funds earned through the program enhance the Automotive program at Evergreen Valley College.  This is the continuation of a site license that has previously been in existence.  The agreement remains the same as the previous one.
	 
Evergreen Valley College will receive the sum of $2,000 per month as a facilities and equipment use licensing fee for the use of its facilities and equipment.
	 
The term of this site license is for three years effective July 1, 2012 through June 30, 2015.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a continuation of a site license to support the State of California BAR Smog Referee and student training program at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Interagency Agreement - Foundation for California Community Colleges State of California BAR Smog Referee and Student Training Program
items.item_text_raw: 2. Interagency Agreement - Foundation for California Community Colleges State of California BAR Smog Referee and Student Training Program

items.item_details:
The purpose of the Memorandum of Understanding between the County of Santa Clara and Evergreen Valley College is to establish the term and conditions to work collaboratively to provide A Tradition of Caring program for new foster parents or adoptive parents through a series of at-home consultations and competency-based training sessions.
	 
Social Service Agency (SSA), Department of Childrenâs Services Responsibilities:
The SSA provides space for classes, evaluates potential clients for program eligibility, and recruits individuals to attend trainings.
	 
College Responsibilities:
EVC provides specialized and advanced training designed to teach knowledge and skills for kinship and relative caregivers:  EVC recruits facilitators to teach the workshops, schedules child care, invites foster parents to the workshops and reserves classrooms with county social services.
	 
Funding:
The Chancellor's Office receives funding for the Foster Care/Kinship program from two primary sources. State funding consists of community college Proposition 98 funds. These State funds are used as a match to pass through federal Title IV (e) funds, by way of an interagency agreement with the California Department of Social Services.
	 
TERM
This MOU is effective July 1, 2012 and shall remain in effect until June 30, 2013, unless terminated earlier or otherwise amended. Delegation of authority expires on June 30, 2013.  There is no exchange of funds related to this MOU.  The agreement remains the same as the prior agreement.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the MOU between the County of Santa Clara and Evergreen Valley College to provide a Tradition of Caring Program
items.item_text: MOU Between County of Santa Clara and EVC to Provide Tradition of Caring Program
